summary: Extract an e-mail address from the mutt aliases file.
name: Mail_mutt_alias.set
description:
This script permit to insert an alias from the mutt aliases file while editing an
e-mail within vim.

Since the version 2.0, we can hit <tab> (in INSERT-mode) within an address 
field (To:, Cc:, Bcc:, Reply-To) to expand an alias. 
If several contacts match the to-be-expanded pattern, a menu is proposed in a 
splitted window in order to choose the addresses. 

Dependencies :
v2.x+ : a.vim                http://vim.sourceforge.net/scripts/script.php?script_id=31
          Actually, you should download an old version of a.vim that still exports its functions

v2.2+ : words_tools.vim http://vim.sourceforge.net/scripts/script.php?script_id=143


N.B.: The command (:Ca) and the macro (,Ca) have been abandonned since version 2.3.
install_details: Update the path to your mutt aliases file, and put the file anywhere you want -- N.B.: $$/ftplugin/mail/ is certainly the best place you could find.

versions.release_notes: Some minor enhancements and several bugs fixed.

Many bugs have been corrected, now the script runs under VIM 5.6-Solaris. A tagging feature has been added in order to select several e-mail addresses in the list. And <tab> can now expand aliases/names expressed as regular expressions.
Correction of some regexps + definition of a syntax highlighting scheme for the menu.

Fix some problems when several aliases match a pattern through a menu to choose from.
Map tabulation as an expand character for aliases ; only within the address lines of e-messages headers.
